intro: Lightfootia perotifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink.
